parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From arche and sunagoge; director of the synagogue services.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Apparently a primary word; a female child, or descendant.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To flay, trouble, annoy, vex. Apparently a primary verb; to flay, i.e. to harass.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A teacher, master. From didasko; an instructor.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.
